it.polito.computervision.gestures.impl

Class ZoomGesture

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polito.computervision.gestures.AbstractGesture
      • it.polito.computervision.gestures.TwoHandGesture
        • it.polito.computervision.gestures.impl.ZoomGesture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Gesture

    public class ZoomGesture
extends TwoHandGesture
    Implements a zoom gesture. Can be configured with allowed directions, thresholds and whether it is live or not. Custom data: -initialDistance: float (the initial distance between the two hands, in mm, when both have touched the screen) -currentDistance: float (the current distance between the two hands, in mm)
    Author:
    Giovanni Piumatti

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ZoomGesture(java.lang.String name)

      • ZoomGesture

        public ZoomGesture(java.lang.String name)

      • ZoomGesture

        public ZoomGesture(java.lang.String name,
           ZoomGesture.Direction direction,
           boolean live)
        Creates a zoom gesture with the given name, direction, live or not, using default thresholds.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the gesture
        direction - The allowed direction
        live - Whether it is a live gesture or not

      • ZoomGesture

        public ZoomGesture(java.lang.String name,
           ZoomGesture.Direction direction,
           float detectionThreshold,
           float completionThreshold,
           boolean live)
        Creates a completely configurable zoom gesture.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the gesture
        direction - The allowed directions
        detectionThreshold - The difference (in mm in real world coordinates) between initial distance and current distance of the two hands in order to trigger detection
        completionThreshold - The difference (in mm in real world coordinates) between initial distance and current distance of the two hands in order to trigger completion
        live - Whether it is a live gesture or not

    • Method Detail

      • doReset

        protected void doReset()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGesture
        Implementations should place their reset logic here
        Overrides:
        doReset in class TwoHandGesture

      • doUpdateState

        public GestureState doUpdateState(HandData[] hands,
                         boolean touchReleased)
        Concrete gestures must implement this method. The semantics are the same of Gesture.updateState(List, List). When two hands are touching the screen at the same time, those become the currently tracked hands, and are passed to this method until either AbstractGesture.reset() is called or any of the hands is lost (not tracked anymore)
        Specified by:
        doUpdateState in class TwoHandGesture
        Parameters:
        hands - The HandData currently being tracked or null if there are no hands being tracked yet. The array will always have a size of 2.
        Returns:
        The GestureState this gesture is in after the update.
